html: Navy pilot Everett Alvarez was the first U.S. aviator taken captive during the Vietnam War in 1964 & remained a POW until his release in 1973. He went on to serve as deputy director of the Peace Corps & deputy VA administrator, & he founded a IT company #HispanicHeritageMonthpic.twitter.com/mDP6A7Ua45

html: His youngest daughter at the time of Mike’s death was just a baby. Mike never got the chance to see her grow up into the phenomenal woman that she is now, because he put himself in harms way to defend our freedom and protect our way of life.

html: In #Texas alone, an estimated 42,000 #computing jobs went unfilled in 2015, yet only 2,100 computer scientists graduated from our schools. I was honored to join the discussion on how we can grow our #tech workforce at the #Bipartisan #HBCU Caucus #STEAM Day of Actionpic.twitter.com/JL0JrxAeCf
